Reviews.Title: “Thank you to the staff”
Reviews.Author: AntPta
Reviews.Content: We would like to thank all the staff for the friendly way they helped us during are stay in Amsterdam. We highly recommend A-Train-Hotel. Near stastion, busses and tours. Again thank you!!! Greetings from room 105 29/03-09/04

Reviews.Title: “Best Location for a tourist in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Traveller38Europe
Reviews.Content: An average Hotel in the best location of Amsterdam. Small rooms and poor breakfast. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Simple rooms, good location.”
Reviews.Author: Jadey_2012
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the A-Train for 1 night. We arrived at about 12.30pm and appreciated our room being ready for early checkin. The room and bedroom were clean enough. Although not sure about the cleaners attention to detail as there was food leftover in the fridge. The staff were friendly and the hotel was well located, perfect for 1 night but not sure I could stay there for a longer period.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: monica1978
Reviews.Content: I am so glad we found this unique hotel with such a charm! We booked it directly from the hotel web site as the price offered was much better than on other sites we usually use for booking hotels. The location was perfect and the price was right. The staff was very friendly and they gladly recommended trips and things to do/see when we asked. They can also book tours for you on request, free of charge. You will get a map of the city when you check in and that will come in very handy during your stay. Everything is within walking distance from the hotel. We never had to use public transportation within the city center. We walked a lot and we saw a lot! Comfortable walking shoes are a must for sure!!! The hotel is located just across the street from the Central Station, so you do not have to drag your luggage a lot before reaching it.The easiest way to get to the hotel is to look for the Victoria hotel and walk towards it. Pass this hotel and keep walking for 2 more minutes before reaching A-Train Hotel. We arrived at the hotel at 10:40am after a long 9 hours flight. What a delight to find the room ready and waiting for us! We stayed for 4 nights (March 14 to March 17, 2012) in room 109 B. There was no noise at all as the windows were facing the courtyard. The view was not important to us. We just needed a clean and quiet room to sleep in at night and this hotel delivered! We left the hotel every day around 9am and returned after 9pm to a quiet, clean and cozy room. The room size was adequate for us (for a room this size you can easily pay double in Paris, for example) and if you do not have a lot of luggage (more than 2 suitcases and 2 backpacks), storage space would not be an issue. The bathroom size was also decent (no bath tub, only shower - again, not a problem for us at all). The computer by the reception desk was always available and free to use if you needed to check emails, book trips, etc. Internet connection in the room was available for a fee. Same applies for watching TV. We did not feel the need to watch TV as we were tired after exploring the city every day. We just used the computer downstairs for checking emails and the weather :) Breakfast was also good, offered from 7am to 10am. You can't compare it with the American style breakfast, but the variety offered was enough for us (hard boiled eggs, ham, salami, cheese, jelly, butter, 2 types of cereal, 4 types of bread, orange juice, milk, coffee and tea). The hotel is non-smoking (a plus for us since people in Amsterdam smoke a lot and the canabis smell on the streets is strong at times) and they ask guests to keep quiet and do not party in the rooms. We liked this a lot and we appreciated the fresh smell and the quiet atmosphere that we encountered at the end of each long sightseeing day. If we go to Amsterdam again we will definitely stay here. If you want luxury, look elsewhere. If you want a clean, quiet room within walking distance to every attraction in the city center, then put this hotel on your list.

Reviews.Title: “Great wee hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Montysadog
Reviews.Content: Booked a 3 night break with wife. Booked hotel after seeing reviews but was a bit worried after seeing the pictures of the hotel. Well we didnt need to worry. The hotel is wonderful in every way. Great location opposite Centraal Station and for exploring this wonderful city. Hotel is "Railway" themed, very clean, great continental breakfast and great helpful staff. We would thoroughly recommend staying here and when we return to Amsterdam we will be staying again

Reviews.Title: “A WEE BREAK.”
Reviews.Author: 1010peter Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was small but nice,my room was at the front of the hotel over looking the main road so not much sleep. So ask for a room at the back for a good nights sleep.Location was very good just over the road from the train Station.And 5min stroll to Dam Sq..

Reviews.Title: “A great base for exploring Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: GnomeLampy
Reviews.Content: We wanted somewhere reasonable for a family trip to Amsterdam, so we booked the apartment room. It was basic, but great value at about Â£100 per night for all five of us including a typical continental breakfast. The apartment is in the attic of the rear (B) side of the hotel - so away from the noisier street side. The room was clean and rather quirky and fun, with 3 children's beds on the upper level and a double bed and toddler bed with a play area and some toys downstairs,which is a nice touch if you have young kids. There is a small kitchen area with fridge kettle and microwave, very handy, and a wet room style shower/toilet with a nice powerful shower. The beds were very comfy, the TV a little basic but working and has some uk channels. WI-Fi is 7.50 Euros for 24 hours or use the free communal computer in restaurant. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful from the outset letting us store our cases and offering us breakfast when we arrived a few hours early. We would definitely recommend this hotel to our friends and anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Maria R
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 3 times now and have found the staff very friendly and helpful each time. Ideal location facing the centraal station and just a few short minutes walk to everything the centre of Amsterdam has to offer. A room on the B side of the hotel is best as the A side is on the front of a very busy and noisey street. The rooms are very clean and of average size for Amsterdam hotels ( all are small due to the nature of the buildings). Would stay there again as its easy to find and very central

Reviews.Title: “so convenient”
Reviews.Author: moshimima
Reviews.Content: a very convenient hotel..its very near to the amsterdam centraal. walking distance. very easy to find. And near to damrak. for muslim you can find many halal food nearby damrak. and near to the amsterdam cruise counter. and the room is very nice, tidy and comfortable for the price. the bathroom's clean. you can also get /buy hotwater at the ground floor. i like this hotel :-)

Reviews.Title: “Close to the train station”
Reviews.Author: aurelio_marchesini
Reviews.Content: Small Hotel very close to the train central station. The hotel looks like a train. Good for short staying. Mattres to soft. No restaurant. The city centre is in a walk way distance. Buffet breakfast within standards. Prices relatively high but probably you can not find anything cheaper with the same quality and facilities nearby in Amsterdam. Approved.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: ziggyperth
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in October 2011 for 5 nights. We loved it all. The Dutch suite was more than suitable for the two of us. The small outdoor patio and quaint decor made for a very plesant stay. We definitly did not get disturbed by noise from the street. Only down side was our room was not ready on arrival at 3pm in afternoon. We had to wait once we found the error. The Dutch Suite has stairs to go up and down so if you are not able to cart luggage may be a problem but we are fit and it wasnt an issue. The breakfast was fresh the staff very friendly and we had a very plesant stay. Location is the best I dont think it can be bettered. Perfect place to stay for a short visit.

Reviews.Title: “Another excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Boltonbloke
Reviews.Content: Our 3rd visit to this smart,warm, clean hotel, Staff are very friendly, even offering us an umbrella because it was raining! Its a great base for exploring the city, bieng straight facing the railway station and five minutes walk from the red light area, the heart of Amsterdam with all the best nightlife, bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Could not be better”
Reviews.Author: 532Oliver10
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location just opposite Central station. My wife and I have just had a 3 night stay in room 303, The bed was most comfortable and gave a good sleep ready for a days shopping, the room was very quiet located at the rear of the hotel. One night we slept with the window open as it was quite warm. Breakfast is the continental type but plentiful and of excellent quality. Staff are warm and friendly and eager to help. My wife has mobility troubles and there is a lift so we had no problems. A good priced hotel which we will use again next time in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, cosy, great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bunblebeaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in the October half term. The hotel is easy to find, being almost opposite the central station and less than 5 minutes walk from the entrance where the tourist information and canal boat trips are. We arrived before 10am, expecting to leave our bags and have a walk round the city. However, our room was ready for us and this was a great bonus as we got to have a quick nap after an early start. :) The reception staff were always polite and friendly, although we didn't have much dealings with them apart from handing in our key/getting our key back when going out. Breakfast is a continental breakfast: I don't understand what people expect from a continental breakfast as some of the reviews about this have been bad. However, there was 4 different types of bread to choose from to have toasted or as it was, chicken, ham and cheese as well as different cereals, boiled eggs and jam/marmalade. This certainly filled us for our day. The room was small, although not smaller than any other typical hotel room in Amsterdam and was clean and tidy. We did not have any problem with the size of the room though and it suited us fine. There is a computer with interent that is free to use for guests in the lobby and I believe it was free wifi in the lobby area as well but we didn't use it. A great tip at this hotel is that there is a board with lots of different cards on it that give you freebies or discounts on museum entry. This worked out well for us and certainly better than the iAmsterdam card which you have to pay for, as we didn't use the tram or bus system at all. As I've mentioned the hotel is opposite the central station - easy for connections to the airport and within 10-15 minutes of the main attractions in the north of the city- Anne Frank's house, Dam Square, Red Light district, Science Museum, and many shops and restaurants. It is little longer to the south of the city to the Vondelpark and the Van Gogh Museum, although you could also get the tram. The highlight of our trip was the BOLS factory opposite the Van Gogh museum. It was pretty interesting and you get a cocktail and 2 shots included in your entrance ticket at the end. I would definitely stay again. If you have any questions please feel free to ask.

Reviews.Title: “Solo traveler”
Reviews.Author: Solotraveler1044
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently situated opposite the railway station which was the main reason I chose it, the rooms were extremely small and very hot, the overhead fan was of little use in cooling the temperature in the room. Friends were not allowed to visit in the room. The single bed was the size of a hospital stretcher. The buffet breakfast in the small dining room could be very busy if you chose the wrong to time for breakfast. Would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A train Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: David L
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location... Go to the VVV tourist office and book there for last minute reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Best buy hotel at Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: ChristinaF
Reviews.Content: Right across the street from Central Station, A-Train Hotel offers a Dutch breakfast buffet at a cozy train-themed breakfast lounge. Cannel cruise terminal and the bus station are just across the road. Major tourist sites are about 15 minutesâ€™ walk. Our family room furnishes with two single beds upstairs and one queen bed downstairs, one dining table, two sides of large windows, as well as Kitchenette and kids play corner. The staffs were friendly and helpful for all kind of information. Complimentary computer keeps us connected, but it was occupied in the morning and late evening. We took the advantage of its safe and convenient location as a base to visit Aslsmeer flower Auction, Alkmaar Cheese Market and Rotterdam.

Reviews.Title: “It's got character”
Reviews.Author: allrite
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a family apartment, which got the thumbs up from our three year old for the toys and the ladder to the upstairs floor with the two single beds. Decor was a bit scruffy and bathroom basic, but nothing atypical for a normal European hotel. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful and the train theme adds real character to the place. Conveniently located close to the train station and tourist area. Internet access is expensive and purchased separately. Very basic breakfast, but nothing unexpected for Europe. We would be more than happy to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and small”
Reviews.Author: WendyLloyd
Reviews.Content: Nice friendly staff, feels secure and clean, but rooms are stupidly small with no tea making facilities, noisy outside (trains/road) listed up windows every morning, felt like a bedsit. Breakfast is very basic, served 8am til 10am, at 9.30 hard boiled eggs are cold, ham and cheese low on supplies, not good considering the cost! Also was 'mistakenly' given a twin not a double, beds staggered in the room because they barely fitted so couldn't push them together to make do. When pointed out the owner argued that a double meant two people not necessarily a double, despite their own website specifying double and twin. We think they had no doubles for the first night and therefore rather than lose the booking put us in a twin and played dumb. He refused a 7.50 euro credit on the tv to make up for it. Overall it was ok, but for the money, ok isn't good enough really.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: r0wan99
Reviews.Content: My sister and i stayed here for 2 nights in december 2010. Room was clean and cozy but a bit small, breakfast was good, staff was friendly and helpful. Location was perfect because it was walking distance to the train station as we took thalys train from paris to amsterdam 2ways. Had to pay to get internet access. Would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: mscorr4
Reviews.Content: I love the location of this hotel, across from the train station, walking distance to Red Light District and shopping areas. The room we had was a good size, it was in the lobby-back area, roomy for three people. Breakfast is good, tv is not free, but you don't need it....you have to go out and experience Amsterdam (: The staff were accommodating - say hello to Mohammad ! I will book this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Somethng Different”
Reviews.Author: irvine33
Reviews.Content: Made booking after seeing reviews on this site. The location is good its close to the main train station and not far from shoping areas. If you want to do a canel cruise the boats are just across the road. We stayed in room 404 on the 4th floor and found it very small compared to other hotels. Was a bit of squeeze with 2 suitcases but managed to sort problem off. The staff were very friendly and helpfull. Breakfast was basic bread cheese jam eggs cereal coffee and tea . If like to eat out would suggest you go to Joshlota a small spanish style restaurant foods is good and cheap (try meat skewer or chicken skewer about E8.50). Turn left from hotel walk down to next cross road turn left til come to cross street is on left across from coffee shop. All in all the hotel is basic and clean and if looking for cheap accomodation in heart of town is worth visiting. Also walk across road from hotel and look at it you are not seeing things the building is on a lean to the left its part of what they call the drunken buildings. Also if want to travel around use all day passes for trams can be purchased at main train station.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, fun and great basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: DonJan_Wirral
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here recently for our third visit. We took our daughter so booked the 3-bed room, which turned out to be the attic room. The room is actually 2 rooms, a bedroom with 3 single beds up steep windy stairs and a small lounge area with 3 chairs, TV and desk, plus cleverly fitted shower room. As usual, the room was clean, the staff amazingly friendly and helpful and the hotel peaceful (we must have missed the stag or hen parties). The location is great, 100 yards from the train station and easy walk to all of the popular areas. Next door is a supermarket, which you can walk right through and out into a shopping area with restaurants, coffeee shops and bars. The breakfast is basic, bread, cheese, ham, boiled eggs plus some cereal and yoghurt, plus coffee and orange juice. The main attraction is the train theme, which is obvious in the quirky pullman style booths in the breakfast area - which gives a great private feel! Free internet access is also available in the breakfast area. All in all, basic, clean, friendly and well worth a visit. we will return again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: rljurek
Reviews.Content: Great location near the train station. Just minutes walk from Amasterdam Central and right in the middle many sights in downtown Amsterdam. The owners/receptionists were great in offering help and advice to us as this was our first trip here. The room was very quiet and quaint.

Reviews.Title: “Take the A Train?”
Reviews.Author: sasfields
Reviews.Content: That tune is still humming around in my head! The hotel room was small BUT not as small as some we've had in hotels in cities. The welcome was warm, the room was clean, neat and the space well organised, breakfast was good. The staff were all very polite, helpful and friendly. We'd definitely stay there again if we found ourselves back in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Very very Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Atul_Mishra
Reviews.Content: 1st time i been to Amsterdam and wanted to stay at most comfortable location. the location was good near to Main station but my room was very very small. smaller then i can imagine. But got 10 to 20% discount coupons and deals from Hotels. Like on canal ride and wind power plant tour pickup is from hotel entrance. Over all it was great experience but because of Amsterdam not because of Atrain.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Clean, Friendly, suitable for families & business travellers”
Reviews.Author: kleaneasy
Reviews.Content: This was not my first visit to the A Train hotel having stayed before on 2 prior occasions. The hotel is very well located, and directly opposite Amsterdam Central station. Travel from Schiphol Airport by train is a short journey and on arriving at the station the hotel can be found on the opposite side of the road so you wonâ€™t get lost. The location also places the hotel in prime location for the many cruise companies, and walking distance from the many local tourist sites. The hotel does not allow groups of all male guests, so if youâ€™re looking for somewhere to stay with children the hotel is perfect. The A Train doesnâ€™t promise luxury and the rooms are quite basic but they very are clean and comfortable. The room we stayed in this time (sleeps 3 in single beds) was a good size and quite spacious, however itâ€™s worth noting if youâ€™re not familiar with Amsterdam or other European cities spacious rooms are NOT the norm. The previous double rooms Iâ€™ve stayed in here were quite cramp but this is on par with other hotels in the city. Breakfast is included in your room, and offers a buffet of breads, cheeses, cold meats such as ham, yogurts, boiled eggs, cereals, tea, coffee, juices etc. The food has been excellent every time Iâ€™ve stayed without fault. There is a reason Iâ€™ve stayed here 3 times now, the staff are friendly and the rooms while basic are very clean, comfortable and reasonably priced, and breakfast cannot be faulted.

Reviews.Title: “first class hotel”
Reviews.Author: winstonblack
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Atrain for 3 nights,the hotel is very clean and looks just like the photos on the website.We had a twin smoking room at the front facing Central Station,the beds are very comfy and can be pushed together,if you want a quieter room ask for a room at the back of the hotel. The traffic noise might be a problem for some but not us. The bathroom was large, for Amsterdam, and clean with the towels changed daily. The breakfast was plentiful and you could eat as much as you like ( the fruit toast was our favourite) with as much coffee as you could drink. The staff always had a smile and were only too happy to answer any questions that were asked. Although we're not into the railways this is one train we cant wait to catch again!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel - We will be back”
Reviews.Author: kd1315
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. Located very near the train station, hop on hop off canal bus stop and walking distance to the red light district and other attractions. The staff was very friendly and the room was perfect for two adults and two teens.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: DrJetsetter
Reviews.Content: This is a great 3-star hotel in a perfect location. It's just across the station. It's a regular 3star hotel but I think the best thing about it are the very friendly staff. Very good breakfast too!

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: GregDallas_TX
Reviews.Content: Very convenient to train station for quick in and out trip. Price was a good value. Staff very friendly and accomodating. Street noise was a bit loud. Not sure I would stay there with the family.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel with extremely friendly staff. Affordable prices and brilliant location.”
Reviews.Author: s11has
Reviews.Content: To put it simply, I wouldn't stay anywhere else if I went back to Amsterdam. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Everything was as advertised and mentioned on their website. The room was spacious and clean (we had booked a 3 bed room). It was priced for economy and breakfast was included. Our choice of breakfast was limited - but that's because we were vegetarian. There was a free internet kiosk provided free of charge and unlimited drinks from the vending m/c (this may be a limited period offer because the hotel is being painted from the outside and the owners wanted to compensate for any inconvenience caused - not that it was causing any - we were out the whole day and came back late at night) Earlier reviews had told us that they ask for the whole amount to be paid in advance - so that wasn't a shock. The hotel was well worth it so no complaints. Located very close to the train station, bus station, tram station and the red-light district; this meant we saved a lot of time and money on travel

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Mat1414
Reviews.Content: Great location. Staff helpful and friendly. Rooms very small and no air con or fan in bathroom. Meant room was VERY hot. Don't think I could stay there during peak of summer.

Reviews.Title: “Unique, hotel, friendly and central”
Reviews.Author: jk48
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in the A-Train and found it to be very clean and comfortable, although our room was quite small, facing out onto the street, and canal. Renovations were being done on the hotel when we were there, and scaffolding was up on the front covering our window, but the workmen were very respectful and did not look into our window, and they were always finished by 4pm. The hotel is based on the owners love of trains, with the eating area set out like an older style train with luggage racks above the seats and lots of train signs and maps. Breakfast is provided in the price, lots of cold meats,cheeses, cereal, fruit, yoghurt and coffee/tea etc. Staff are very friendly and always willing to give instructions on how to get places. The hotel is a short walk from Centraal Railway Station, and trams pass close by to go to the centre of town. Would recommend this hotel for anyone who only wants to stay a few nights and does not want to pay the extremely expensive prices of some hotels in Amsterdam. There was also a free computer that you could use to access the internet, or pay to use your own lap top in your room if you wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Fault It”
Reviews.Author: FelixNottinghamUK Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent location -the staff were friendly and helpful and the reception was open 24 hours-the rooms were small but very clean and comfortable.Other good features were the complimentary breakfast which saved money and the lift..Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: colbry
Reviews.Content: Only booked this hotel on strength of their Website description and photos. On arrival it was just as described, staff very friendly and family room well furnished. The whole Hotel is kept very clean. Breakfast is a Buffet offering cereals,toast, cheese and meats, tea coffee and chocolate, typical Continential and eat as much as you like. No tea / coffee making facilities in the rooms but the breakfast buffet machine is available during other hours to purchase hot drinks for 1.20euro a cup. Our room B2 was at the back of the hotel with windows looking into the small courtyard, very little noise so good sleep had by all. Can't comment on any of the other rooms. Situated just across the road from the Central Rail Station it is really convienient for trains and trams, it's only a short walk to Dam Square and all the shops. Very good train service from the airport. If we return to Amsterdam the A Train Hotel will get our business again.

Reviews.Title: “choo choo chuffed.”
Reviews.Author: smoggietraveller
Reviews.Content: Interesting hotel in a rather bizarre city.. Excellent location pretty much right over the road from centraal station and within a few minutes walk of most things (but then again - everything is!) This is a small, clean and friendly hotel with a bit of an odd theme - very clean and friendly and all you could ask for in an inner city hotel. rooms are smallish - but in such a densely populated city space is at a premium so this is to be expected. Ours was at the back of the building so the view left a bit to be desired and there was some building work going on across the little courtyard thing inbetween buildings which was a bit noisy on the first day... again though - we didnt expect tranquility. Nice sized bathroom though and everything worked as it should.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Global_Traveller1306
Reviews.Content: We booked for one night to accommodate three people and were pleasantly surprised by the level of cleanliness. There was also good service from the front desk which was covered 24 hours. I searched high and low for a room that would accommodate three people and this hotel met all of our expectations including value for money. The central train station was located directly opposite the hotel (2 minute walk). This hotel was in a very good location considering the other seedy areas around. We felt safe at all times while staying here and the hotel had a strict policy regarding keys and inviting others into rooms which was great to see. Overall, don't expect the Marriott, but a friendly, value for money and secure place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: saqrajan
Reviews.Content: This hotel was right near the central station ( 3 mins walk) and 5 mins away from Dam Square. We booked an triple room and the room was great very spacious with 3 beds! The bathroom/shower was very clean and modern! The staff were amazing very friendly and helpful. Felt totally safe the hotel has strict entrance policies which is always a good sign...24 hour concierge ..room had a safe as well which is always good! I would def book this hotel again on my next visit to Amsterdam! def recommend this place to anyone wishin to visit Amsterdam and be near Dam Square/Central Station/Red light distrcit

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jrhodes54
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the A Train hotel in February,we went for a weekend break.The hotel was opposite Central Station so very easy to find.The staff were lovely and very helpful,a lovely blonde lady from housekeeping I think, told us about places to visit and how much to pay for a beer so you were not ripped off.The room was nice,very clean and the train theme was brilliant.The hotel was nice and central although Amsterdam is not that large and you can walk to most points of interest.We found a nice bar a few yards from the hotel,when you leave the hotel turn right and it is on the corner,you must try the cherry beer it is wonderful but it is 8% so you only want one! if we go to Amsterdam again I would certainly stay at the A Train again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: whitewitchHull
Reviews.Content: From the very beginning the manager was excellent , a very prompt reply to my email requesting a (tobacco)smoking room and whether we could leave our luggage after we checked out..A nice welcome when we arrived, and our room ready at 11am.If it hadn't been, they would have stored our luggage until we returned later Room quite small but very clean. We were on a ferry trip from Hull and the coach stops almost outside the hotel making the location absolutely excellent, no trawling cases through the streets and we were able to pick the coach up on our return just across the road.We bought canal trip tickets from the Hotel, much cheaper than at the "port" All the staff were very friendly we even got a free cup of coffee when we arrived..

Reviews.Title: “Room for Five!!”
Reviews.Author: Markw58
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights with my wife and three daughters. Had the apartment which comfortably slept the five of us. Had a small kitchen area with fridge and microwave. The upper floor with three single beds has no windows so can be very dark at night, but we left a bedside light (pointing towards the floor) on all night but you may prefer to take a night light. Excellent value for money 145 euros/night. The breakfast was very good, try the raisin bread toasted its delicious!!! Staff very helpfull and friendly, rooms clean and warm. Would definately go back without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: EnglandPost
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, comfortable clean warm rooms, all you could wish for, for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel- No bed bugs in sight!”
Reviews.Author: zotar
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Airmiles for a weekend break to AMS. Read some reviews on here and was a bit wary of the hotel after reports of bedbugs! However, no such problem. Right next to the main station- so ideal for travel, friendly staff who were only too happy to help with directions etc. Room was small but functional, but then how much time do you spend in it anyway? Breakfast was the usual European affair- toast and Nutella, so you can't go wrong there. All in all had no complaints at all. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great base, Great staff”
Reviews.Author: HOLABALU
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel, as it appeared to be the best cheapest, central hotel without any 'genuine' horror stories. Yes, the hotel's by no means 'Four Seasons' quality, but you're sure as hell not paying that kind of money either. When we visit cities to site see, and we do that a lot, our main objective is to find somewhere as central as possible, with decent reviews, that's cheap, but most of all, clean! This little hotel in our opinion, ticked all of those boxes. The hotel's directly opposite Central Station. We got a train from the airport, to this station, it cost around 4 euros each, and took just over 15 minutes to get there. The staff at the hotel were very welcoming. They were polite, friendly, and professional. We requested to change rooms, as the one we'd been allocated was possibly in the worst position you could ever want your room to be in. On the ground floor, in between the breakfast room, and next to the lift. We had to wait over 3 hours until our other room was available, but this wasn't a problem. We left our bags in the luggage room, and went out to do what we came for - to sight see. I think each individual room is different in this hotel. Ours was very basic, but had everything that we needed, and expected for the price we paid (not very much), and the room was in a very quiet part of the hotel. Don't be expecting a little tray in the bathroom with complimentary shower caps, moisturiser, shaving kits etc, as there isn't any. There's a dispenser with hand wash, which was fine by us, as we like, and take our own stuff. There's a safe in the room, and a tv with some English channels on it if you're bothered. Breakfast is served between 7-10am. It's a very small area where the food is, but it's adequate, as it's only a small hotel, so there wasn't a huge battle to try and get food. There's a few cereals to choose from, a few different types of bread (the fruit bread is gorgeous toasted), and there's some sliced cheese and ham. There's hot drinks available, and orange juice. You can also have boiled eggs if you ask. The blonde lady who was there at breakfast was lovely, nothing was any trouble for her, or any of the staff for that matter. Their English is excellent!! Checkout is at 11am, and the staff check your room before you leave. So be prepared to wait 5-10 mins, in case you checkout bang on time, but have to leave straight away. Our flight wasn't until much later on, so we left our bags in the luggage room until we were ready to leave. When you come out of the hotel, if you turn right, there's a place on the corner called the 'Soup Kitchen'. It's great value for money, and the soup's home made, and very nice. It was ideal, as the weather was ice cold when we were there. There's a restaurant called 'CAU', and in our opinion, it was fantastic. We had the nicest steaks we had ever eaten, and they're cooked in front of you. The staff were efficient, and friendly too. There's lots of quirky little places to eat and drink, as well as the bigger, more established places, and there's lots to do. It's the first time we've ever been to Amsterdam, and we thoroughly enjoyed it. It was better than we expected, and we'd most definitely return. I'd like to go back in the Summer. It's not the cheapest City to eat/drink in, and you can very easily spend the cash if you're not careful. Luckily, we weren't on a tight budget, but if you are, shop around for lunch/dinner, as everywhere seemed to charge totally different prices. As long as you don't forget, that it's a low budget hotel, then you shouldn't be disappointed. Do your research before you go, like we did. That way, you shouldn't have any nasty surprises. Everyone has different opinions, and standards, so be mindful that they're just that. We appreciate nice things/surroundings, and have been lucky enough to stay in some wonderful places - but we're no snobs. If you are, then don't stay at the A Train hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Train Station... That's about it”
Reviews.Author: Brian1311
Reviews.Content: After spending 2 months in Europe, Amsterdam was our last destination . Laid out well with the space provided, the hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The train theme was felt throughout the hotel which was a nice novelty. Unfortunately we stayed in Amsterdam during a heat wave which made sleeping in the hotel room impossible as there is no air conditioning! The room was small... Infact it was tiny. The beds were two hospital beds pushed together which made a concrete floor look appealing! The decor was tired and depressing. On the last night in the hotel my fiancÃ© newly laid sheets had bed bugs in them. Disaster! The food was.... Crap! The spread of rice bubbles and stale bread was tasteless and insulting. Fortunately there was a lot to do in Amsterdam which ment we didn't need to spend a lot of time in the hotel. If you use drugs and your staying in this hotel make sure you roll a big one! It's the only way to ease the pain!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel on the city centre doorstep.”
Reviews.Author: shayman1
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel which was right in the city centre and only a short walk from the train station. Friendly staff regardless of who was on the front desk, Nice clean hotel we was lucky to get a backroom in the hotel which was quiet, En suite twin bed room with tv (even picks up Bbc 1 and 2) only downside with the room was the extremley soft mattress but that was only a tiny blemish on an otherwise top room. Breakfast in the morning was included and had a selection of bread, ham boiled eggs and cereal. The best part was the hotel even let us leave our bags at the hotel for 7 hours after we had checked out so we could carry on exploring the city, Given the amount of people we saw carrying theirs around i was very grateful for this service. I would stop again without a moments hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in a great place”
Reviews.Author: AthensLefteris
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean with basic breakfast offering (toast bread,cereal,cheese ,ham,egg) Room was small and same were the beds ,not changing towels and sheets upto 3 nights . No freeze or phone in the room just tv. Except the location across the street from central station ,dont deserve a price of more than 70 Euro / night.

Reviews.Title: “do not book a single room”
Reviews.Author: sx_Greece
Reviews.Content: Maybe the smallest room Iâ€™ve ever stayed in a hotel. Not that clean, old towels, hairs in the shower. But rather nice breakfast and good location. A typical example of a hotel in Amsterdam. For sure it doesnâ€™t worth the 105-145â‚¬ per night, but this is Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great value”
Reviews.Author: sjl0151
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend break in Amsterdam and have to recommend this hotel. The location is perfect - right opposite Centraal Station and walking distance to Dam Square and Anne Frank's house. The hotel and its rooms are small and not the most modern, but as we spent very little time in our rooms it was great. The breakfast was quite basic but nice and the staff were really helpful - they even let us decorate the eating area one evening to mark my sister's birthday. I did a lot of research before the trip and this was one of the cheaper hotel options, so I was concerned there may be some issues. But it was great and would definitely recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Characterful, Excellent Location, I Recommend It”
Reviews.Author: SussexTraveller88
Reviews.Content: If you travel by air to Amsterdam you will arrive at Schipol airport, and the quickest and most inexpensive way to travel into the city centre is by train. There is a railway station in the airport complex, and tickets can be obtained from either the self-service kiosks located in the airport's entrance hall or from the ticket office at the rear. Tickets from the ticket office are slightly more expensive, perhaps 50 cents more. Trains depart from a level below here. When you arrive at Amsterdam's Central Station leave by the main entrance, then turn right and walk past the taxi stands. When you come to the bridge over the canal, cross it, and as you walk over look to your right. You will see the A-Train hotel's sign on the hotel's roof on the opposite bank, about six buildings along to the right. The journey from the station to the hotel is only about three or four minutes walk. The hotel is located between a gift shop/mini-market and the rear entrance of a large supermarket, although it is not readily apparent when you look at this latter building that it is in fact a supermarket. On the floor of the small reception area of the hotel is painted a railway track, and this feature extends right through the Pullman Lounge, which is the breakfast room to the rear of the building, and is one of many very characterful features of this delightful hotel. We found the reception staff to be very helpful indeed, and they all spoke excellent English. Access to the bedrooms is by passing a tag on the key fob over a sensor and care needs to be taken not to confuse the tag, as we did, with the one for the television! Bedrooms are in two blocks, A at the front of the building and B at the rear. B is accessed at ground floor level only, and through the Pullman Lounge. There are two lifts, one in each block. Our room was in A block and fairly small, as I think many of the rooms are at this hotel. The furniture consisted of twin beds, with individual lights, a less than full sized wardrobe with two shelves, but the safe, which was free took up much of one shelf's space. There was a narrow shelf fixed to the side of the wardrobe and a desk, plus two chairs and a television. Some channels you have to pay for, but several are free. We stayed for four nights, and had we have stayed longer I feel that the lack of provision for clothes would have posed something of a problem. There was no air-conditioning, but there was a portable electric fan, which we needed because the weather was very warm. The shower room was quite large enough, and the only toiletry provided was soap from a dispenser, so do be sure to take your own. Our room was very clean, and I personally found the bed extremely comfortable, but some people may have considered it to be slightly soft. We were at the back of A block, so it was quieter than a front room would have been, but the down side was that the view was of the rear of the other block. We weren't concerned at all though by this. The breakfast room is extremely characterful. There are tables arranged in booths for two or more, and over the seats are the type of luggage racks that used to be found in trains of former days with even small suitcases on them. Train memorabilia abounds throughout, with pictures of railway stations and trains from all over the world. Breakfast was a cold buffet, with plenty of choice, including cheeses, meats, breads etc. Hot drinks are obtained from a machine, and are free during breakfast hours, after that they can be obtained at any time for a very modest charge. The lady who served in the breakfast room spoke excellent English, and we found her to be very helpful at all times. My only criticisms of this hotel are that most of the bedrooms are fairly small, although I understand that there are some larger ones at an extra cost, and the lack of space for clothes. Other than that I have only praise for the hotel. It's very central, Amsterdam is a very easy city to walk around, and if I should return again to Amsterdam I would certainly consider staying at the A-Train and have absolutely no hesitation whatsoever in recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but too noisy”
Reviews.Author: markjchambers
Reviews.Content: Close to the train station, nice staff, decent breakfast, but postage stamp rooms. Central Amsterdam is small enough that you don't need to stay right in the center. If I did go back I would ask for a room on the A side - not on the street. It took earplugs and drugs to make it through the night.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: nut_meg28
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located about 5 mins walk from the centraal station and is a short walk to all touristy places. Very easy to find and on the main road. No disturbances from road traffic or from the train station at night at all, and we had a comfortable sleep. The hotel is designed with a 'Train' theme as the name suggests and my wife found it very amusing!! There is a vending machine downstairs, which some may find useful.. The staff is very helpful and friendly. Rooms/ Bathrooms are clean and well maintained. The breakfast is also sufficient and good. On the last day we went at 11:00 AM as we did not feel like getting up from bed earlier. Surprisingly breakfast was still available, even though the stated time is till 10:00 AM only. One thing to be aware of is that, though the hotel advertises 24hrs check-in, it really is not so. They should tell this clearly to avoid disapointment while checking in. I arrived with my spouse at around 7:00 AM and even though the booking confirmation said 24hrs check-in, the manager asked me to come back around 12 noon- 1:00 PM. He offered us tea/coffee, use of toilets and clean towels to freshen-up. Perfectly happy, we left around 8:00 AM and returned back around 1:45 PM. However the room was not yet ready and the new person at the counter said that the check-in time was only after 3:00 PM!! On complaining about not telling this to us earlier, he apologised and offered us 2 free tickets for 1hr canal cruise. Though not a substitute, this did calm us down someway. Finally returned at 3:30 PM to a clean and cozy room to catch-up on 2hrs sleep.... before heading out again... The other issue was that though there is free internet, the system is painfully slow and pretty much useless. Needs replacement urgently, before someone can use the free internet...

Reviews.Title: “Best location & Clean rooms!!!”
Reviews.Author: Map01
Reviews.Content: First of all apologies for the belated review! The hotel was really very conveniently located! Opposite the Centraal Station and near everywhere one wants to go in Amsterdam. We hired bicycles went around, it's the best way to see the city!! The rooms were very clean, simple & quiet. Reception desk people were also kind & answered all our questions with patience. The breakfast was excellent! Musli, yogurt, fruit, milk, coffee, tea, juice, eggs, bread, cheese, ham... a very nice start for our days there!!! All in all we spent 3 nights there but it seems they were not enough! I can't wait to go back to Amsterdam & the A-Train Hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.......Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: weiser
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for part of our honeymoon, hotel was a great location. Walking distance from Central Station and walking distance to Red light District. Hotel was small hotel with very small rooms. It was clean and offered a free breakfast. We ended up with 2 twin beds so my husband and couldn't sleep together but for the price of the room it was fine. Staff here was excellent they were very friendly and helpful. They also spoke perfect English. Would stay here again might just pay a little extra for a larger room..........

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: fraidofflying
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a three-week stay at this hotel, and I cannot rave about it enough, and most especially the staff. In three weeks you learn the ins and outs, and this place was exceptional. The first night, the bed was extremely soft, and I told the manager, Ali Hassan, that for so long a stay,, I could not sleep on that mattress. That very day, he had cut a piece of thick board to the size of my mattress, and put it under it. Worked well. He and the rest of the staff were wonderfully kind and patient to our many questions, helpful and knowledgeable. The rooms were clean, the breakfast adequate, the location, right across from the Centraal Station, terrific. And a big plus, not easily noticeable, was that right next door, on the left, was the back entrance to a complete supermarket, beer and wine, fresh fruits and vegies, salads, breads, everything. Plus an ATM inside the door. We did have a "premium" room, that had a fridge, makings for coffee and tea, and a lounge chair. Storage was good too. Breakfast, from 7am to 10 or a little later, was always well stocked, and at any time of day you could pay 1.20 euro for a cup of most anything you wanted. In a word, they treated us like family and I would not hesitant to stay there again in a heartbeat. One caveat - our room faced the front and it was most always quite noisy from the street. However there was no noise from within the hotel itself, having only four rooms to each floor. And the view was great. For those so inclined, there is a casino to the right of the hotel. And if you're into trains, this is most definitely the place for you, as the owner and manager have amassed the most amazing collection of train collectibles I've ever seen. In the rooms, in the halls, and in the breakfast area. People would take pictures of all the stuff. And do make reservations; the place was most always full.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MaggieMay2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the A-Train Hotel, Amsterdam for 3 nights with friends - it was fantastic! The staff are very friendly and we felt part of the family. They were very helpful with directions, booking events, taxi's etc. The security is great - you leave back your key as you leave and get it back when you return. We felt the staff knew us all and all other guests which made the hotel feel like a very safe place. Location is absolutely perfect - its across the canal from Central Station - near enough to walk with any amount of luggage and far enough that you can't hear the trains! Trams 2 and 5 go from outside Central Station and these got us to all areas that weren't walkable (in the heat!).

Reviews.Title: “bad rooms”
Reviews.Author: beachboydublin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is across from central station thats it, the rooms are not good Pay a bit more money and go else were.

Reviews.Title: “Unique with great staff”
Reviews.Author: tweed38
Reviews.Content: Spent a delightful three days in Amsterdam and could find very little to complain about this hotel. Brilliant location across from rail and tram station. Handy for canal boats and a short walk into central Amsterdam. Really friendly helpful staff. Surprisingly quiet at night. Loved the train theme in the hall and breakfast room. No stairs to climb as lift fully functional. If we go back to Amsterdam would book this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “clean, warm hotel”
Reviews.Author: EastSussexJules1969
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as it was a special rate, arrived really easy to find as it is accross the road from central station. Checked in only to be told one of our rooms wasn't ready and we had to come back in an hour, The hotel states check in from 2pm so we were put out really as we wanted to rest a while as we had been on the go since 2am the previous morning. The rooms were small but compact, it would have been a nice touch to have tea/coffee making facilities. The rooms were lovely and warm and there was plenty of hot water. I would re stay at this hotel again as it was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Queen's Day in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: ZacharyB1
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam is most beautiful in the spring, they celebrate Queen's Day and there are lots of travelers there. We always stay at the A Train Hotel while in Amsterdam, it is in the perfect location, the staff exceptional! Rooms are perfect and prices fair compared to other hotels, all around fantastic place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “home from home in the `Dam'”
Reviews.Author: logoscregor
Reviews.Content: I only stay at the A-Train in Amsterdam because of the staff's friendliness and their willingness to make your stay fun and easy-going. I've visit Amsterdam 5 times a year minimum for both business and holidays; I don't stay anywhere else. For a 3-star hotel in the easiest spot in the very centre of the city; you can walk to the main areas near the station very easily; and the trams are a few minutes away from the Central Train Station. The rooms are always clean; the breakfast is standard Dutch and plain, though good quality; and you would never know you were in the city centre for the peaceful atmosphere in the hotel. Economic rather than the cheapest price; I've never felt the price was unreasonable - and as a businessman, I look for as much bang for my buck as I can get!!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and lovely staff top marks”
Reviews.Author: dannyboyfc21 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: could not fault this lovely hotel with great staff that made our stay very welcome and we will be back... and if love or like trains youll the train theme though out great place and location just across the from the main train station

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the most convenient place to stay in Amsterdam?”
Reviews.Author: stoaty123
Reviews.Content:
"A lovely quiet hotel, in just about the best location possible in Amsterdam, from the airport get on a train straight to centraal station and it is right across the road. Perfect. The staff were helpful friendly and smiling, the beds were very comfortable, sheets crisp and clean and the bathroom adequate for our needs, complete with power shower. The rooms are all small and very basic, there is a telly and a hairdrier in the bathroom, what else do you want? We spent almost all of our time out exploring this exciting and buzzing city.
Breakfasts were good, a selection of breads, preserves, cheese, meat, eggs and cerials with fruit juice and tea and coffee. You want somewhere basic cheap easy and convenient to stay in Amsterdam? The A-Trains the one." "Top tip! don't get on a train without buying a ticket! you cannot pay the conductor once you are on, they will charge you an extra 35 euros plus your fair, as we almost found out.... Enjoy your stay in Amsterdam!"

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, clean”
Reviews.Author: jillybird
Reviews.Content: Great location just across the road from the train station, central to all the highlights of Amsterdam. However we paid for a premium room and had exactly the same rooms as the rest of the party who had paid 90 euros less. Tiny room with the bed pushed up against the wall, very small wardrobe and no drawers. The bathroom was adequate and clean. No kettle but there was a notice to says drinks could be fetched from downstairs-- 1.20 for a glass of hot water and coffee and 2.20. All our party asked for kettles but were told they had to upgrade so I asked thinking at the price I had paid ( 119 ers per night) I was upgraded but was also told no. Eventually I sweet talked the lovely breakfast lady to give us a tray. The noise was dreadful with the traffic only calming for about an hour between 3 and 4 am. 5am was like the outbreak of hostilities and we had to close the window at this time. All that said it is a lovely hotel and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “would go again”
Reviews.Author: lottie44
Reviews.Content: great position, right across from central station and within walking distance to all the other parts of Amsterdam. we loved it and the rooms were clean and comfortable. the staff were very friendly and we got a room upgrade because it was our anniversary. the hotel is very quirky and may not be to everyones taste but overall it was great for the short trip we wanted and we would go back.

Reviews.Title: “basic basic hotel not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: lsalr
Reviews.Content: close to central station..thats all i ave to say good bout this hotel; the room did not look the same as the one on website very disappointed. single beds at either side of the room{for a couple) which the view out our window was another guests room which was so close that it was only just over a metre away not joking..having a smoke in my room 1 evening and happened to glance at the windows opposite and though and behold a guys naked butt. i,ve stayed at the damrak last yr and i,ve read a few bad reviews this yr so we picked this one now i wish we had went back to damrak cause it was a hell of alot better than this crappy place..also i couldnt stop itching..

Reviews.Title: “A-Train Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: dkritype4u
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Amsterdam and not knowing what to expect, we wanted to stay close to Centraal Station. We were on the last leg of a 3-Country tour, with Amsterdam being our biggest expense. In saying that, I was a bit disappointed with the overall quality of the hotel vs the room rate. The twin room was European small and the beds could have been a bit more sturdy (the mattress kept sliding off the frame). The bath was compact, but clean. The walls were thin and there was no AC (they did provide a fan). The breakfast (included in the price) was pentiful and they had a mixture of cold European and American staples, plus coffee, tea, orange juice, milk and toast. The staff was exceptionaly friendly and polite, but the guy at the registry desk was a bit aloof, but helpful. So, I don't have anything to compare the quality to, but the location was absolutely the BEST! It was in walking distance to/from Centraal station (across the street), clubs, the tourist office, tour stops, souvenir shops, red light district, shopping, museums, and every transit system offered by Amsterdam. Now if you ask me if I would consider staying there again; knowing what I know now? Absolutely, but I still won't like the price!

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: theresaandgeorge
Reviews.Content: this was my first trip to amsterdam with my husband who has been before thiswas to celebrate our silver wedding looked at a few hotels and hubby picked this one it was very nice and clean which is the main thing andthe staff were very pleasent the location was spot on just across the road from the train station not far to walk about 2 minuets went down to breakfast once looked nice but not my cup of tea had a coffee hubby had tea toast n cereal said it was ok but i prefered to go out for a breakfast elsewhere so many places to choose from the staff in the hotel never bothered you n if asked anything were very helpful the roomwas a double smoking room with a view of the canal n station its was very clean and had double windows you could open up which was a bonus as it was very warm the bonus was that there was a lift which worked thank god as we were on the 4th floor i would recommend this hotel to anyone who does not want to travel to far from the station as it is well located to dam square red light district ect i will book this hotel next year as i enyoyed my time there and cant wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Great theme hotel with fantastic staff.”
Reviews.Author: ratje
Reviews.Content: We were looking to stay as close as possible to the Amsterdam Central Station and eventually booked the A-Train hotel. We couldnâ€™t have chosen any better! The staff was just incredibly friendly and helpful. The hotel was all decorated with train themes in a witty style, definitely done by someone with a heart for rail transport. Our room was on the 3rd floor, quite large and smartly organized. The room was facing the main street, with a view to the railway station.. Ok, there was a bit noise from the street during the day, but it was still acceptable during the day (who spends his day in the hotel room in Amsterdam anyway?), and everything had all calmed down during the night so we could sleep with our windows open. The breakfast was very good, although I missed some fruit or fruit salad (my standard breakfast â€˜starterâ€™). I guess it's just not a part of the traditional Dutch breakfast. In conclusion, we really enjoyed our stay. A-Train hotel is really something to remember and to recommend further.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: galwaysgirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the A-Train with three friends, in the top floor apartment/ quad bed. We all loved it. We got the train from the airport and when we stepped out of the train station we could see our hotel. We checked in and took the lift to our room, the lift doesn't quite go the whole way up to the room and there is quite a tight but short flight of stairs leading to the room. It can be difficult to navigate this stairs while carrying suitcases but it wasn't a problem. The room itself is of a good size for amsterdam, the decor is quite old fashioned but the room was clean. The wet room was nice and clean. In this quad room there was a bedroom just off the sitting area semi enclosed with no door. Then there is a staircase leading up to the attic room again with no door, but we didn't mind this at all. This apartment had bags of charcter and was excellent value. The breakfast was adequate, cheese bread and meat. The A-Train is quite close to a tourist office for you to plan your holiday, its just the other side ofthe canal, back near the train station and you can buy tram tickets here. There are many lovely restaurants and pubs very close to the hotel. The red light district is a short walk away and the canal boats athat take you very very close to other great tourist attractions is on the canal a one min walk away. I am now planning on returning to this hotel with my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Management”
Reviews.Author: rarnett
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after being led to believe room would have canal view. Arrived and a "full" sign displayed with owner standing in doorway having a cigarette and just called out "full". I explained I had a booking so he went to desk and pulled out my booking, asked for the money; I asked to see the room first and he reluctantly gave me the key. Bed was against the wall with a wardrobe at the foot of the bed, so that one person had to literally climb over the second person to get out of bed, which had "a view" of the back of wardrobe. I went back downstairs and explained that this wasn't what I had been promised; manager rudely told me "no water view" and so I said I couldn't stay as not room promised and too dark, stuffy and unpleasant staying couple of nights looking at a huge wardrobe in front of one. So I left and went across the road to The Ibis for same price, and a water view. The Manager has taken one night's tariff from my credit card without permission so now have to get Bank to look into the matter.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and staff; some drawbacks though”
Reviews.Author: tjsb01
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Amsterdam, and the A-Train was recommended to me by a friend. When booking, it was obvious that Amsterdam wasn't a cheap place to stay - three nights at the A-Train was a fraction under â‚¬350 with one of their 'hot deals', which seemed to be on a par with other hotels in the mid-range sector. The hotel couldn't be easier to find - you can see it as soon as you exit Centraal Station - it's literally one minute away. The chap on the desk was very friendly and we were checked in within a couple of minutes. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived (2.30pm) so we left our bags in their cupboard and went for a wander. The location of the hotel is brilliant - out of the door and turn left for the canals of the Jordaan, turn right and you can be at Dam Square or in the Red Light District within a few minutes. The museums are a little further away, but the beauty of the A-Train is the proximity of Centraal Station - the transport hub of the city. Jump on one of the frequent trams and you can be in the museum district in about ten minutes. When we returned a couple of hours later, we were given our key and directed to room B004 - this is on the ground floor at the rear of the hotel, just beyond the dining area. The room was very small - this seems to be a theme in Amsterdam given the nature of the city's buildings, but I think this room is smaller than most, certainly when compared with pictures on this site. The room had a TV, desk and wardrobe with a safe. No tea or coffee facilites, although there was a snack and coffee vending machine near reception. The bathroom was good - nice powerful shower in the corner, although the ventilation was terrible and made the rooms very warm. The weather during our stay was excellent (25 degrees plus, no cloud, little breeze) which was fantastic, except the room was a bit of a sauna. No air-conditioning available (there was a fan, however) meant that things got a bit warm. The room backed onto a small area between buildings so there was no wind at all, and the windows barely opened. This, coupled with the crampedness of the room, was probably the biggest let-down. A buffet breakfast was included in the price of the room. The offerings were okay - breads, cheese, ham, cereal, yoghurt and the coffee vending machined switched onto 'gratis' mode. I have had much better offerings from similarly pitched hotels elsewhere in Europe, but it was enough to start the day with. In summary, the staff and the location made this hotel. The room was pretty poor, and the ventilation and lack of spcae is a real issue when you've spent all day on your feet and just want to relax. When I go back to Amsterdam, I think I'll choose somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “we loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: dannykwan
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay in this hotel because it was one of the only hotels that we could find that offered a FAMILY ROOM and after looking on trip advisor as we always do we decided to book the A trains family room. We have stayed in Amsterdam before (pre children) at the Radisson hotel and since it was going to cost nearly 800 euros for a quad room we opted for the cheaper option at the A train hotel and we are glad that we did, the hotel staff were very friendly and the place was clean and our room was a very reasonable size and based on two floors, the breakfast was included and there it was more than ample and also the tourist tax was included in the price. it was important to us when booking a room in a smaller hotel with kids that we didnt end up with a room over a knocking shop so some internet detective work was in order and again we booked the A train family room because of the reviews, it was safe, clean and it was like a little haven in a place that is full of hustle and bustle..we just loved this hotel and would reccommend its family room to any family that is looking for good safe and affordable accommodation in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great location hotel, but aquired taste for theme!”
Reviews.Author: Flylikeabird2006
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying the Hotel is in a fantastic location for P&O ferrie travellers as the coach from the europort drops you straight outside the hotel! You can then lock your luggage away and explore the city! The reception area is nice and quirky as is the lobby, all based on the train/travellers theme, staff are very freindly too. We stayed in a good room the "dutch suite" although i must say I hated the decor it isnt anything personal against the hotel It just gave me the creeps, I understand the idea to make it a period piece, although I felt i was staying in a museum room. With features such as dolls pram, brass kettles, portraits on the wall, typewriters etc. You dont need any of the magic ****** to illucinate in here! The room was very clean and all the amneties were present, tea and coffee, freeview TV even with BBC! Also had a massive wardrobe. The room was spacious although very dark, and had its own garen perfect for if you go in summer or if you smoke, also the bathroom was a nice size too and also very clean. One thing I must add is yes I have been to open bathrooms before where their is no shower cubicle or curtain just the shower and yes the floor does get soaked no matter what other people say its invetiable with no barrier-we just re-used our towel on the floor! So dont be surprised! Theres plenty of drainage. Breakfast was ok what youd expect from a european hotel,douge egberts coffee toast, fruit bread, cheese and ham etc Overall a good hotel based in the centre with easy access to buses and drop offs/pick ups just have an open mind for the rooms! For one or two nights its perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: half-full55
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Amsterdam, having taken a small group of students to carry out business research for school course. Selected A-Train Hotel on the basis of reviews on another site, and was not disappointed. The rooms are small - so are most city-centre hotel rooms; particularly in Amsterdam because of the architecture! Surely most reviewers have encountered wet-rooms before? Much more hygienic than mildewy curtains! Because no single rooms available when we booked at short notice, we booked First Class room for single occupancy (on-street view which many like in a city), 2 double/ twin rooms each for single occupancy and a triple room. All were very clean and comfortable and met our needs. The view from the double rooms was over a building in the process of being renovated, so lots of building debris, but we were there to be out doing research, so not a problem. The cost was lower than going elsewhere and paying additional charge for breakfast or local tax - paid 382 Euros for 4 rooms occupied by 6 people - great value. Self-service breakfast in the 'pullman lounge' was excellent - juice, cereals, boiled eggs, ham, cheese, toast, fruit breads etc Staff were welcoming helpful and efficient. Location - directly opposite Central Station (or P&O Ferries bus if you have had a mini-cruise to Rotterdam) was so convenient for arrival(no problem locating it) and departure. Would I return? Absolutely - with students or with partner.

Reviews.Title: “Stay some place else if you can”
Reviews.Author: GBV
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for two days 18/19 Oct 2008. Pros: - Staff is friendly - breakfast is included and is quite decent - hotel lobby/reception area makes for great pictures - Breakfast area is done up very well. - very close to the central station and the other attractions in central amsterdam. 20 mins by train from airport - has a secure room to store luggage in case you check out in the morning and have a plan to catch only in the evening - safe and good for families or couples Cons: - a very congest place - rooms disappointingly small -- one person has to sit on the bed for the other person to have enough space to walk around - the loo area is waaay too small...one can't move arms in the shower..also if one sits on the throne, the knees touch the wall!! - heating didn't work well - better places out there for the same amount of money if possible, do a bit more research and stay some place else. we, my wife and i, regretted paying so much money for just two nights and staying in a place so congsted that we couldn't even strech our legs properly. over all a 'B-' rating only because the rooms were a big disappointment..seeing the room for the first time will make you think 'what....?!! that's it!?'...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Clean ad Friendly”
Reviews.Author: judyrose
Reviews.Content: Just had a 1 night stay in the A Train in Amsterdam - wished it was for longer! The hotel is right across from the Central Station and ideally located. On entering you cannot miss the train memorabilia, the owners must be real enthusiasts - it was great! The Rooms were spotless we booked a double and the family room. We had a kettle and microwave in the family room which was also on two levels. Breakfast was served in the Pullman Lounge. There was a good choice of meats and cheese and plenty of coffee tea etc. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. We will definitely stay here again at this delightful hotel. Thanks for making the visit to Amsterdam special for us.

Reviews.Title: “Not Far from Train Station”
Reviews.Author: shan77
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 1 night before heading off to Belgium. The hotel is about 5 mins walk from the train station. Good location if you are travelling by train to your next destination. The cafe has a nice "train theme". The breakfast fair was just average..nothing to fancy. I booked a triple room, the size of the room was small and the bathroom did not have a shower curtain so after a shower the entire bathroom will be wet. Overall, had a good experience.The rooms were clean and the receptionist was friendly. Would recommend it to traveller who won't be spending too much time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for visiting Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: therealbridgetjones
Reviews.Content: We booked the A-Train hotel after reading other reviews on Tripadvisor. Some of them were not favourable but the criticisms were not about anything that would bother me so I booked anyway. We booked the "Old Master" suite which has its own little courtyard garden which we didn't actually use as we were out & about most of the time. The room was very clean and plenty big enough for us & had a lovely en suite shower room. Despit previous comments we didn't get the floor soaked just a little spray from the water while getting washed. The bed was comfortable & there was tea/coffee making facilities as well as a TV which had English speaking channels but we barely switched it on. The staff were friendly & helpful & as we informed them in advance of out arrival time they had the room ready for when we arrived. This is probably not possible in high season as the room will be occupied from the day before. We were allowed to leave baggage in a secure room on the day of check out too. The hotel is perfectly placed for those arriving at the train station or as we did on a coach from Rotterdam as it is very close to the drop off point. We got off the coach & looked across the road & there it was. It does have a train theme which I thought was very nice, if you don't like that sort of thing then you probably won't like it but it does after all make no attempt to disguise that it has a theme so no one should be surprised. The restaurant has railway buffet type seats & decor. The food was a usual continental style breakfast & was very nice, everything was fresh & plentiful. The problem some people have with leaving the key at reception was not a problem with us, we have had to do that in many hotel that we have visited & I actually prefer it, stops me losing it. As someone is at the reception desk all of the time there is no problem with picking up/dropping off of the key. You are given a little card to show them when collecting it. All in all I really enjoyed my stay & the only downside was that we couldn not stay longer. I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: HendraBrisbane
Reviews.Content: Extremely handy location, almost opposite central station, yet tucked away from the hustle and bustle. The staff here are very friendly and helpful. You leave you key with them every time you leave and they are behind the counter 24/7. We left our bags with them after check out and they locked them in a designated room so we could pick them up later. Although its close to central station I felt very very secure. Our room was small but had a lovely window and outlook and modern TV. Very clean and breakfast was buffet style cold meats, cheeses, yoghurts, cereal, toast etc. We didn't have tea and coffee making facilities in our room but took our own portable jug. You can buy tea and coffee from a machine downstairs though and it was quite cheap. Overall I would highly recommend this place if you are looking for value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and location. Freindly folks.”
Reviews.Author: doobieref
Reviews.Content: I wish we would have stayed here for the 3 days we spent in Amsterdam. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and hospitable. The hotel is located almost directly across trom the train station. It is not the most beautiful place but it is very reasonable and nice. The room was quiet and comfortable. The breakfast was great and coffee too. Every other place we stayed we had to pay for everything. Here you could have two cups of cofffee without paying an arm and leg. The breakfast area was real cute with train memorabilia all over the place. If you want to save money and go plain this is a fine place. If you want to pay more and more stay elsewhere. We stayed at the Sofitel the next two nights and I was unhappy. Enough said.

Reviews.Title: “All Aboard!”
Reviews.Author: majaprov
Reviews.Content: The A-Train Hotel is a nice small hotel with warm staff. The location of this hotel is close and convenient to Amsterdaam Central Train Station. The room was very clean as was the bathroom. If you are looking for a large luxurious hotel this is not for you. If you are looking for an affordable clean, comfortable spot to stay in that has a style all it's own, then you can't beat this hotel. Breakfast in the morning was nice and the front desk staff was very helpful to me. I am a woman who travelled to Amsterdam on my own and felt very safe and comfortable and even "looked" after at this hotel. Especially if you are coming in at night and don't want to wander the streets trying to find your hotel - this is a great place to go. This is not an american style hotel, but I found the beds to be very comfortable and got a great night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “VERY HANDY LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: kiwisahoy
Reviews.Content: A very easy hotel to find and stay in. Loved the location and all hotel staff etc where very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was adequate and would have no trouble in staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great location and experience”
Reviews.Author: Bob_C44
Reviews.Content: This was a great location and choice for our "family" of two grandparents with three grandchildren. We booked the "Apartment", which could sleep six. The location was very convenient to all of Amsterdam. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. Inexpensive parking for our rental car was explained by the staff. The only downside would be if the weather turned very hot as there is no air conditioning, but several fans are provided. The hotel was very clean and the breakfast was good, if not fancy. It was great for our group. Even the train themed decor was delightful. The hotel seemed very popular and was often filled. Be sure to book early, expecially for the larger family rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good Base To Explore Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: BROCKWELL
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews after booking I was a little apprehensive of what we might find, but overall it was quite acceptable. We had room B106 which is at the back of the hotel, on arrival the room was clean and pleasant although quite small(see photo). When two people are trying to get ready to go out it can be a squeeze. Our friends had a room on the front which looks out onto the busy road outside. No aircon so we could open our window and not get the noise,our friends were not so lucky, nice view but noisey when the window was open.
