Other travellers should bear this in mind if visiting during hot weather.The rooms did have portable fans, the toilet and shower were clean with good water pressure and heat. The breakfasts are the usual continental fare but above average.The drinks machine is free during breakfast 07.00 to 10.00. Afterwards a drink is 1e 20cents. No drinks facility is in the rooms.A small supermarket is next door if you need snacks or refreshments other than that offered in the hotels vending machines. Due to it's ideal location close to Centraal Station,(walking with luggage is not at all to difficult), the hotel has a room for luggage so on checking out you can leave your bags until you need to travel back.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, stay here!”
Reviews.Author: HandballYaz
Reviews.Content: This is a fine hotel. It is right across from the Centraal Station so it is perfectly suited for touring around Amsterdam and for day trips elsewhere. Our room had a clean, comfortable double bed, small writing table with chair and a closet for hanging clothes. It also had a safe which was nice. The bathroom was also clean and actually spacious with lots of hot water and good water pressure. The breakfast was standard fare and tasty and served until 10 am so you could sleep in a bit. We found the hotel staff to be very friendly, multilingual and pleasant to talk with. My only minor concern was that our room faced the main road so it was a bit busy even at night which made sleeping with the window open a somewhat noisy experience. Still, it is a fine hotel which I would definately stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints!”
Reviews.Author: mhigbeem
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews on TripAdvisor.com and seeing that the hotel was within walking distance of Centraal Station, we decided on A-Train. It was a bit expensive, but ithat was my fault for not booking a room sooner (it was pretty much the cheapest hotel we could find in the area tho). We flew in from London and got to Amsterdam around 11am. Check-in wasn't until 2pm, but we walked to the hotel to drop our luggage. The 2 gentlemen behind the front desk were extremely friendly and helpful (and spoke very clear english). We were thrilled when they said our room was already ready and gave us the key (we'd had to leave London a 4am so were eager to take a nap [after visiting our first coffee shop first, of course])! The hotel is small and narrow, but what building isn't in Amsterdam? The whole "train motiff" is cute. Our room was no bigger than the size of an average dorm room, but it was all we needed. Yeah, the fact that you have to pay extra for TV sucks, but no biggie. I was actually impressed by the selection of food they had for breakfast. They had cold cereal, hard boiled eggs, breads for toast (with an assortment of jams, honey, peanut butter and chocolate spreads), sliced cheeses and meats, orange juice and coffee (although the "milk" for the cereal looked more like the consistencey of yogurt). The location was perfect. All-in-all, it was a great stay and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb find!”
Reviews.Author: neilalyn
Reviews.Content: This is the fifth time we've stayed at this hotel in three years. Having been to Amsterdam approx. 12 times in the last five years. This is by far the best hotel we've stayed in. Great location, good service, great rooms. O.K., slightly pricey, but compared to some of the other places we stayed at, I think it's worth paying the extra.

Reviews.Title: “If you smoke or if you like service - Give this a miss.”
Reviews.Author: theherbalizor
Reviews.Content: I am a regular visitor to Amsterdam, and there really isnt much wrong with this Hotel. Its comfortable if a little small, and centrally locatted, its just their very poor service that lets the hotel down. First off the we asked the receptionist where the nearest coffee shop was, he told us then proceeded to check us in and take our payment upfront (a little strange i thought). Then once all checked in and after he had told us where our room was he informed us that we were not aloud to bring Cannabis onto the premises and if we were found to be smoking on site then the police would be called. Now he knew we were smokers and yet still took our money off us before telling us of the Hotels policies. Not being ones to rock the boat we abided by their rules, but found the staff to be rude and abrupt and it seamed as tho any question was just too much for them to answer. Overall if your part of a family and can put up with shear rudeness then you may find this hotel a good stay, else its back to the Multatuli for me which is just along the road which makes it a little quieter than the A-Train too.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Perfect "Little" hotel”
Reviews.Author: stackobell
Reviews.Content: What a great little hotel!!! Yes the rooms are small but lets face it all you should be doing is resting your head in the hotel. Nice breakfast, really nice staff (owner looks a bit cross at times, but is ok!). Hotel is directly across from centraal station. The one and only downfall is You have to pay â‚¬7.50 for the cable channels. but if you want to watch TV you should stay at home. Oh and they say you cant "smoke" in the rooms but you can. i mean after all, it is amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place !!”
Reviews.Author: janfrwa
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean room, decent breakfast, good price. Very close to the train station and a short walk to canals, sightseeing, shopping. Yes, the rooms are small - however they were comfortable. Photo is actually two twins pushed together, not a double. We stayed for 2 nites. Desk clerks were friendly and helpful. My sister was ill and the clerk provided an excellent reference to an English speaking doctor who responded immediately with a prescription. They did request the key when we left as did another of the hotels we stayed at during our 10 days in Benelux. We were fine with that - didn't have to worry about losing the key and the hotel always has access to your room even if you keep your key. Use the safe or carry valuables with you. Internet connection was available for a low price. Best: it had a lift! Worst: if you let the shower run too long, it overflowed into the sleeping area. Would definately stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful welcome, great location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Bingley1
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Amsterdam before, we searched the internet and grilled friends for hours about where to stay. Having finally decided to opt for the A-Train and having read the reviews we were delighted with the Hotel. This was our anniversary weekend and the hotel provided flowers for my wife. All the staff were extremely helpful, the rooms are comfortable with modern decor. It is located 200 yards from Central Station which is far enough to avoid the noise from the traffic. I would highly recommend this hotel to those with a low to medium budget. It is within walking distance of Dam Square and the other major attractions

Reviews.Title: “recommended”
Reviews.Author: mikem01
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 1 night after a disasterous night in another hotel, when we arrived at the hotel we were given a key to check the room and it was WELL worth the price we payed,rooms are spotless and staff very helpful, literally a stones throw from all the main shops and hotspots of the city, breakfast was excellent and as much as you wanted, all in all i would recomend the Atrain to anyone who is looking for a fantastic stay in amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice Here”
Reviews.Author: MrGusCotati
Reviews.Content: I am very happy that i stayed at this hotel. It is conviently located near the train station for arrival/departure and tram use while in town. It is far enough away from the trains that noise is not a problem. The staff was friendly and spoke english well. Room was typically european (small, adequete). One drawback was that the room did have a cigarette smell going on. Bathroom was clean and modern. The entire city center is within walking distance, although trams are best for traveling to the Van Gogh Museum area. Breakfast was fine...and also run-of-the-mill european. Ham, turkey, cheeses, toast, cereal, and coffee/juice. I paid about 95 euros/night for a twin room (Sun-Wed). All in all a fine choice and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Little Place in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: newzealandgirl
Reviews.Content: One of the huge bonuses of this place is its handy location. You just hop on a train from the airport, and the hotel is visible from the train station. You can get there within 2 minutes! It is also located right in the heart of Amsterdam, within walking distance of everything a tourist would want to see. The staff were helpful and friendly, allowing us to stow our luggage until our room was ready (we arrived at 7.30am Sunday morning due to our flight!). Despite jetlag we went straight to the Anne Frank Huis and were first in the queue for when it opened at 9am! The rest of Amsterdam was clearly still sleepy from revelry the night before! The room was very small but quite adequate for a short stay. The bath room was modern although strangely designed in that the shower water went everywhere and almost out onto the carpet. The first shower I took almost flooded the bathroom (due to a block in the drain) but help was sought and the problem speedily handled by the management. I wouldn't advise elderly or disabled people staying here, however. The stairs were very narrow and very steep (much like the rest of Amsterdam) and we had to climb up them to our bedroom. It was very warm when we stayed so we just turned the fan on and opened the windows. There was no street noise at all and we slept very well. The breakfast was very good and prepared us well for our busy days. I think people who criticise the breakfast would do well to recall that it is complimentary and that in most other countries this would not have been complimentary. Overall, it was a great stay and I would definitely stay there again without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value.....”
Reviews.Author: patsybrowne
Reviews.Content: Ideal for a short break, great location across from the central station, walking distance to everywhere or near trams if you prefer. The Old Dutch Suite has small patio with table and chairs and best of all the en suite was spotless, with energy saving toilet flush and fabulous shower.

Reviews.Title: “got to pay to watch CNN!!!”
Reviews.Author: rudy64
Reviews.Content: i have been in many hotels all around the world: in A Train hotel you have to pay 7,50â‚¬ to watch CNN,CNBC and others dutch chennel(brodcast by cable tv) The room are very small and the bed was very soft . Breakfast was terrible and the open bufe seems very poor.The manager and the owner were very rude and nervouse.l will never go back again

Reviews.Title: “Glad we booked the A train”
Reviews.Author: Waipa
Reviews.Content: I spent hours on the internet trying to find somewhere central in Amsterdam that had an ensuite and did not blow the budget. I finally decided on the A-train because of the reviews and it was also one of the cheaper hotels that met our requirements. We took the train in from the airport and had our instructions on how to get to the hotel, but we didn't need them as you could see the hotel straight away - brilliant! Once we were inside we were once again pleasantly suprised - we had expected it to be a little dark and dingy (from photos etc) but it was lovely. I was preparing myself for the difficult climb up stairs but there was a lift! Although I would say that the room is small we were pleasantly suprised again as we had expected smaller and the ensuite was lovely, clean and modern. We thought it was going to be difficult to sleep because of the location but our room was not on the street. There was a little noise from tenants in neighbouring buildings (because buildings are so close) but nothing major. Breakfast was lovely and the staff were very friendly. We would definitely recommend the A-train.

Reviews.Title: “Great value --excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Telcoman2
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to all the action. We got off the train and rolled our luggage across the bridge to the hotel Nice room at a great price. The place is kept clean and the desk people do a great job of maintaining security. Everything is included, in the price, no surprises. The staff is first rate, especially the woman who runs the breakfast room. I recommend choosing a First Class room. This room is bigger and has a view of the canal and the Central Station. The fridge in the room is great for storing drinks and food. Don't concern yourself about the shower set up, the water won't reach the room. The elevator is quite big for this type hotel. Just look out for the high thresholds on the doorways. Remember to lift your feet or you'll go on a trip of a different type.

Reviews.Title: “wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: jrmintz
Reviews.Content: My experience with the owner and a manager of this hotel was horrible. They were both insensitive, cold and rude. Especially considering my reservation had been accidentally deleted on their end. The manager in particular was so rude that if I would've had an option to stay elsewhere, I'd have taken it. The room itself had zero charm and in fact, I had to open the window and prop the door open to air it out from the previous tenants. For almost 150 euros a night, your vacation money is best spent elsewhere. Try the Hotel New Amsterdam which is a mere 5 minute walk west. All the people who worked there were completely amicable, the rooms were charming and my stay was peaceful. If you can help it, vacations should be full of good memories, not bad ones.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SullyAZ
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel with great location near Central Station and Dam Square. Hotel was clean with friendly staff eager to assist. We booked a triple room that had pleanty of room and most importantly was clean and smelled fresh! This hotel provides a safe environment with friendly staff available 24hrs. They also offer a variety of items in the vending machine including Heineken so we were happy! Also enjoyed sitting in the Pullman Lounge area each evening. Breakfast was the only aspect that may have room for improvement- it was good however a variety of cereal would add the extra touch! (I recall only cornflakes being available). While looking for hotels prior to arriving in Amsterdam, I am pleased I chose the ATrain as I was able to see all the other hotels in person once I arrived a did they ever appeatr filthy! The Atrain is wonderful and I cannot wait to return! KS in Arizona

Reviews.Title: “Straight A for the A-Train”
Reviews.Author: onejag
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the A-Train from 31st July to 4th August and can definitely recommend it for value, comfort and central location. Because we would be arriving late evening I wanted somewhere near the Central Station and the hotel is literally only 2 minutes walk from the station entrance. We had a double room rated as 'first-class' which meant it had a fridge and a bit more space and a good view out over the main road to the station, so great for people watching. Continental breakfast til 10.0 am. Traditional pub almost next door, really handy for trams and canal trips. There was no air con in the room (but there was a fan) which could have been a problem a week or so earlier when the European heatwave was on, but it had cooled down when we were there. Would definitely consider staying there again and would recommend it to others. Straight A for the A-Train.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Fiend_007
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Europe for 19 days and my first and last days were spent in Amsterdam. we stayed at the A Train Hotel both days and it was perfect. Great location, good breakfast, and clean rooms. Our room did not have any type of shower curtain so the water went everywhere and there is no AC, but it is still a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: foldedmirror
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Amsterdam and I stayed at the A-train hotel. The airport provides a shuttle to the various hotels in the city. A round trip is 19 euros, one way is 12 euros. The best part about the hotel was its location. Central station is right across the street, the infamous Red light district is a five-ten minute walk, lots of souvenir shops and cafes nearby, the Anne Frank house is a ten minute walk (thereÂ´s a LONG line, but itÂ´s worth it). ThereÂ´s also an internet cafe right around the corner. It costs about 2 euros for an hour. The hotel charges 5 euros for a 30 minutes. The other great thing about the hotel is the staff. They speak English very well and are genuinely kind and helpful. I overslept and was late to the airport for my flight, but they were nice enough to have the shuttle make a special trip for me. My room was just the right size for me. It was very clean. There is no air-conditioning so it got hot at night. They do provide fans which makes the temperature a little better. If you can deal with no A/C youÂ´ll be fine. The shower pressure is great too! I would definitely stay here again, probably with a friend or two. Amsterdam is lots of fun if youÂ´re with your friends or family (:

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: AndreasForever
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in May 2006, the location is great near the central station (only 5 minutes walking). I stayed in a standard twin room, the room was quite small (but this is common in Amsterdam), very clean (so does the bathroom). There is a elevator in the hotel. For more than 1 - 2 days, I suggest to book the bigger room. Breakfast is also good for its level

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: KathyWood50
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the A Train. Great location, with a nice clean & quiet room. The staff were more than eager to assist us with any questions we had. I will stay there, on my next visit. Victoria B.C. Canada.

Reviews.Title: “An Amsterdam Diamond!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Never mind the Amsterdam diamonds - the A-Train Hotel is a little diamond in itself. Having read reviews about the hotel before we travelled (indeed was swayed by them when booking) we were delighted with what we found when we got there. Within a stones throw of Central Station it couldn't have been easier to get there from the Airport and we found a warm and friendly welcome on a cold, wet Amsterdam evening. Yes, it was unusual to be asked to pay on arrival but wasn't a huge problem, and having to hand in the key each time we left the hotel was no problem at all. After all, there is a master key for the maid service so if anyone wanted to "sniff around" while we were out (see comment from Los Angeles traveller) there is always the opportunity, as in any hotel. We stayed in the triple room which was plenty big enough for the three of us and everything was spotless and nicely decorated and furnished. Crisp white sheets on the beds always get a "thumbs up" from me. The only down side was that this was a 'smoking' room and personally I think it's time all such rooms were banned in all hotels. There was a faint hint of stale smoke in the air, particularly when the room had been closed up for the day! The bathroom with the 'wet room' type shower was also spotless with soft white towels - you just had to remember to move everything to the far side of the bathroom before showering. The power shower was excellent and one of the best we've found in any hotel, anywhere. Breakfast was very good and relaxed. A typical 'Continental' breakfast with cereals, hams, cheeses, a selection of breads, boiled eggs, toast, juices, tea & coffee etc. from a free vending machine, and everything fresh. Nothing wrong with that! Much better than the so-called continental breakfast we had recently in a London hotel (why am I not surprised!). The surroundings of the Pullman Lounge was interesting and full of character. In the absence of tea/coffee making facilities in the bedroom, it was also good to be able to get a hot drink from the vending machine any time during the day or evening, at a small cost. For location the A-Train would take some beating. All the major attractions of Amsterdam are within walking distance, and unless you are on a very short break and don't have time to stroll the streets and canals, there really is no need to use the trams or canal boats at all, although both are easily accessible straight across the road outside the Central Station if you do need them. There is a wide choice of restaurants in the vicinity, of all cuisines, so no need to go hungry! In conclusion all I can say is that we look forward to catching the A-Train again some time. Highly recommended unless you want Hilton standards, in which case I would say pay Hilton prices!!!

Reviews.Title: “A-Train great for a short trip”
Reviews.Author: mlf212
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the A-Train for 1 night in the 4 bed room as I had my 2 children and mother with me. The kids loved their mezzanine floor room and the toy box with various toys. The stairs to this room are extremely steep (more like a ladder) but there is a gate at the top of the stairs. Beware if you have very young children though. The room was clean, reasonably spacious and had everything we needed (including the much appreciated kettle, tea and coffee-also had microwave). Location was great. Opposite the Centraal train station and the departure point for canal cruises and trams. Price included breakfast which was good (we're cereal and toast people so were well catered for). I would recommend the A-Train due to location and facilities as long as you're not looking for something lavish. It served us well.

Reviews.Title: “Decent quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: SOAP
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a two night stay at the A-Train hotel and only have one criticism with this quaint little centrally located B&B. I was reluctant to book it at first, but was swayed by the price. The fact that they insist you turn in your key each time you leave the hotel (and pay upfront) gives you that uneasy feeling that you are not to be trusted and you in turn don't feel comfortable leaving important items such as jewelry and passports -- even though they have a safe. Trust goes both ways, and I resent the obvious fact that my movements are monitored and that anyone can pop into my room and have a sniff around. I don't buy the owners comments (fire etc) as other bigger hotels have log books which they rely on to know which rooms are occupied. If you don't trust your customers they in turn will not trust you. Aside from that, it is a clean and quiet and cheap. I was little peeved at first as I requested a room with a view, but got thrown into one without, but after returning to the front desk it was rectified. Overall, it is a decent hotel for a VERY short period -- rooms are really TINY (can't swing a cat!) and breakfast is very basic (cheese, ham, bread, cereal) no hot breakie, but it is a cheap and cheerful hotel. You get what you pay for. Staff are not overtly friendly, not helpful with directions -- more subdued and serious. I won't stay again only because there are zillions of other hotels in Aâ€™dam all also centrally located and as a serious traveler, I firmly believe in never going to the same place twice -- not unless the service (or food) is exceptional and at the A-Train it isn't, but I would certainly recommend a traveler on a budget to stay a couple of nights here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the train memorabilia”
Reviews.Author: Julie1158
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at the beginning of February and were delighted with this hotel. Location is great just a couple of minutes walk from Central Station. We found the staff extremely helpful and although our room was small and a little chilly it was clean and adequate with a great wet room type bathroom. Breakfast pretty good and varied with toast cooked to order. Nothing is very far away in Amsterdam although as it was so cold we took advantage of the 3 day tram ticket - one payment and you can use it on all trams and some of the buses so we explored all over the place!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Neevil
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a stay in the A-train Hotel, Amsterdam, having read the reviews on TripAdvisor. I agree with a lot that has been said regarding the convenience of the location. It really could not be better. Our room was small, quiet, clean and warm and the TV had a nice range of free channels including BBC. The shower was great and the bathroom was spotless. The one problem I had with the hotel, however, was the breakfast. Curly-edged stale cheese on bread that has been out for hours is not very appetising. Although we went down for breakfast before the 10am cut-off point, there was often very little food left so it was obviously not being replaced. The staff were okay but not very forthcoming. Nevertheless I would recommend the hotel if you get a cheap deal, as we did. It was a pleasure to return to it after a cold night out in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a weekend in Amsterdam and since I had used TripAdvisor to determine which hotel to stay at, I wanted to add my 2 cents. The A Train hotel had great reviews and offered the best deal for us; it was also one of the few hotels in the city where a room for 4 people was available. Our experience at the A-Train was excellent, and I would definitely recommend it. It was ideally located right across the street from Central Station, 15min from the airport. The easiest way to get from the airport to the hotel was by train, especially since it only cost 3.60 euros per person. Most places we wanted to visit in the city were within walking distance or just a short tram ride away. The staff at the hotel was very friendly, and the room was clean. The only negative side was the bathroom...it was very small with no shower curtain installed; everything would get soaked when someone took a shower. Breakfast was included, the buffet was pretty simple, yet enough for what we were looking for. I would go back to the A-Train during my next stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaCP
Reviews.Content: We flew from US to Amsterdam, with one night planned in Amsterdam. We chose the A-Train hotel based on price, amenities and location. You cannot beat the location if you are on the train the next day, or if you are going to take a lot of day trips using the train or bus system. The location is close to many sites, as well (we walk a lot - the distances were not formidable from the hotel). The desk staff were all friendly and helpful. I thought the breakfast was good, as I don't expect anything more than coffee and bread/butter when in Europe. Anything more than that a bonus to me! We stayed in the Old Dutch Masters Room, which has a private patio. The rooms are small, but no more than what is usual in Europe. I wasn't a fan of the bathroom - unheated and water everywhere when you shower due to the setup. Our biggest issue was the camera on the patio, which we didn't notice until 20 minutes before leaving - and I'll admit in advance that was unnerving only because as US citizens, we are a bit zealous in our expectation of privacy. At least we know now, and it wasn't a huge issue - we just didn't know about it or expected it. Inroom (through ethernet cable) or lobby internet access was not free - I'd like to suggest making the in-room internet either free or reduce the price a little. Every other hotel we stayed at in the Benelux on this trip had free WiFi. A-Train was the only place using Ethernet and that charged for in-room access for laptops. We would definitely go back if if were winter. The patio wouldn't be so private in warm weather (other rooms look down onto the private patio), and I can see how the rooms might be quite stuffy in the summer, so I would have to take that into consideration in other seasons before booking at the A-Train.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JupilerUK
Reviews.Content: Have just arrived back from a three-night stay in the A-Train Hotel in Amsterdam. Since I often use tripadvisor to weigh up options when travelling I thought I'd contribute something back with my first review here. The A-Train Hotel is very conveniently located, being on the opposite side of a road and small canal basin from Amsterdam Centraal railway station. Thus it is also a short walk from Dam Square and other central attractions. Most of Amsterdam's tram services start from outside Centraal Station (and many buses), and the canal basin mentioned is home to a couple of the companies offering a variety of canal cruises. It is thus easy to get to much of Amsterdam and the rest of the Netherlands quickly and easily from the A-Train hotel on the public transport system. Centraal Station is just a 20 minute train ride from Schiphol Airport - we landed at Schiphol at 2035 and were at the A-Train hotel by 2130. The A-Train is a family-run hotel whose owners are clearly dedicated to ensuring your stay with them is a pleasant one. All the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. We were asked to pay on arrival (even though we had reserved with a credit card), and this might not be every customer's ideal way of doing business but with hindsight, at the A-Train at least, I'm sure of their will to address any justifiable problems quickly. Our room (described as a 'first class' room on their web site) was compact but clean and comfortable and featured a walk-in shower, wc, refridgerator, comfortable arm chair and tea and coffee-making facilities. Heating (radiators) and hot water supply to the bathroom were good. Although our room was situated on the front of the building the windows (when closed) ensured we were not unduly disturbed by traffic or other noise from outside. There is a lift to take you to the upper floors. Internet access is available for those who need it. The breakfast buffet featured fresh white, brown and fruit breads (and toast too), hard-boiled eggs, ham, cheese, honey and jams along with several breakfast cereals and also tea, coffee and hot chocolate drinks. The hot drinks were dispensed from a machine but this didn't detract from their quality. Breakfast was taken in the lounge area (no-smoking at breakfast time) which, along with the rest of the hotel, has a railway theme. No meals are served at the A-Train (other than breakfast) but there is a vending machine between the reception area and the lounge area selling cans of Heineken beer and soft drinks, along with crisps and chocolate. Obviously there is a very wide choice of restaurants in the City - for a lucky-dip selection I'd recommend catching the Tram to Leidseplein (No.5 from the hotel will certainly get you there). Joselito's Tapas bar around the corner from the A-Train (turn left when leaving the hotel and keep walking along and round the block until you find it) is ideal if you want somewhere close to the hotel. I've visited Amsterdam many times over the years and have never found a hotel there that I'd like to return to - until now. Any future visits we make to Amsterdam I'll be staying at the A-Train. I look forward to the next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Chuggin' Along”
Reviews.Author: bsnmsn
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small, but that is the norm for Europe. That said - location, location, location ! Very near the Central station, the main shopping artery, the canal boat tour offices and the grown up fun side of Amsterdam, this little gem is a treasure. Breakfast is included. Nothing fancy, but substantial and you can eat your fill. The management and staff are terrific and eager to pass on hints, helps and every courtesy possible. Loved the train decor. All in all, it is a terrific place to hang ones' luggage ( or backpack ) and start exploring Amsterdam. Oh, there is internet access - either using their pc or your own.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We saw a very good review of the A Train hotel on Tripadvisor and we endorse it. This is a great place to stay in Amsterdam. Very well positioned opposite Central Station. The rates are very reasonable for a 3*** hotel with all the facilities in the room. The room was very small but comfortable, clean and well maintained with ensuite. The hotel has a railway theme and this is well presented in the very pleasant breakast room. The hotel rates include a good breakfast and there is the bonus of an elevator. The staff are very friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, staff helpful and it was very clean. Perfect position just across the road from Central Station, in the middle of everything but still quiet. Would definately use again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean , friendly staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The good things about the hotel. Very friendly and helpful front desk. The was a small problem in our room and management took care of it very quickly. The location is excelent just accross the train station and walking distance to center of city. Rooms: The rooms were very clean, however, even for european standards they were extremly small. When I say small I mean very small. The beds were confortable, but rather low and small.

Reviews.Title: “Its a goodun”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The single rooms are very small but well kept. Staff helpful and efficient. Great central location right opposite the station. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely time in the A Train. We booked the family room, it was a very generous size and on two floors. 2 Twins, kitchen, dining table, cot bed and a lovely shower (no bath) on the first floor. Above in the attic are 3 more twin beds. They also provided a large amount of childrens toys. Could easily accommodate a family of 5, was more like an apartment. As it's at the very top of the building theres lots of stairs (not unusual for Amsterdam) though there is a lift you still have to negotiate a few stairs to your 'Nest'. It can also get quite hot up there. Just open the windows if need be. Room and Hotel was clean, full of character, staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was adequate, some fresh fruit would have been nice, and perhaps the coffee from a vending machine was not ideal, but I'm fussy like that. Would heartily recommend this great little independant family run hotel to any families wanting a comfortable hassle free stay in Amsterdam.

HotelInfo.Name: A-Train Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Prins Hendrikkade 23, Amsterdam 1012 TM, The Netherlands (Formerly Schirmann Hotel)
